newsitem.title: CANADA: Snow stalls Alberta seeding with 1-3 weeks to end.
newsitem.headline: Snow stalls Alberta seeding with 1-3 weeks to end.

text.p: Sixty three percent of crops were seeded prior to delays prompted by snow and rain over the past weekend in many areas of Alberta and northeast British Columbia, Alberta Wheat Pool said in its weekly crop report.
Snow and rain added needed moisture in many southern areas while precipitation in the north and Peace River Valley added to reports of excess moisture, AWP said.

Soil moisture was rated excessive by 16 percent of reporting staff compared to 11 percent last week, very good by 32 percent versus 23 percent last week and good by 33 percent compared to 42 percent the week before.
Seeding could be completed in one week in the south and within two weeks in many central regions. Farmers in the north and Peace regions may require at least three weeks, AWP said.
The Brooks-Lethbridge area was 99 percent seeded, Hanna Empress crop district was 95 percent done and Clareshold Cardston was 94 percent finished, AWP said.
The South Peace crop district had the least acreage seeded at eight percent.
Seventy seven percent of winter wheat and 87 percent of fall rye survived the winter with 88 and 91 percent rated good to very good, respectively.
